page.title: 01North Central Merse
page.content: This block is entirely agricultural; six farms cultivating prime arable land on which barley, oil seed rape and potatos are the main crops. Cattle and sheep graze rotational grass. The only settlement is the hamlet of Sinclairs Hill - Square 2 - which contains 12 houses and a disused school. All the farms have a row of from six to eight cottages, half of which are no longer used for farm employees and are now either disused or let as holiday cottages. Squares 1, 5 and 9 are crossed by the giant pylons taking electricity to the National Grid from Torness nuclear power station, due to open in 1987. The pylons were being erected during this survey.
